(2) The Courier Service Licensing Committee shall consider
the application and shall communicate its decision to the applicant
not later than sixty days after receipt of an application.
(3) The Courier Service Licensing Committee shall issue a
licence to operate a courier service on payment oft he appropriate
fee set out in the Third Schedule and subject to such conditions
as the Courier Service Licensing Committee may, in consultation
with the Minister, determine.
(4 ) The licence to operate a courier service shall specify the
types ofc ourier service business as follows:
(a) international and national;
(b) international and national (urban)
( c) national, urban and rural; and
(d)rural.

service
Licensing Committee shall designate areas within the Republic
as rural and urban for the purposes oflicensing courier service
business in such areas:
Provided that the Courier Service Licensing Committee shall
designate the areas listed in the Second Schedule as urban areas.
